An **elven short sword** is a type of [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is made of [wood](/wiki/Wood "Wood") and uses the [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword") skill, and appears as a **runed short sword** when unidentified.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [4.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [4.3 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [4.4 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [5 References](#References)

## Generation

Player [elves](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)") start the game with knowledge of the elven short sword.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) Any elven character that would start the game with a short sword will start with an elven short sword instead - currently, there are no applicable roles where this substitution would occur.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

Elven short swords make up about 0.2% of randomly generated weapons.

Live [elves](/wiki/Elf_\(monster_attribute\) "Elf (monster attribute)") that are [generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") an [elven bow](/wiki/Elven_bow "Elven bow") and set of [elven arrows](/wiki/Elven_arrow "Elven arrow") have a 2⁄3 chance of generating with an elven short sword, giving them an effective 2⁄9 chance.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) [Player monsters](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster"), including those on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane"), have a chance lower than 1% of generating with an elven short sword as their initial weapon before role-based replacements.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

## Strategy

The elven short sword is the best among short swords, dealing damage on-par with a [silver saber](/wiki/Silver_saber "Silver saber") against a non-silver-hating target or a [scimitar](/wiki/Scimitar "Scimitar"). They are also less likely to be eroded as long as you avoid using them against fiery monsters such as [red dragons](/wiki/Red_dragon "Red dragon") and [fire elementals](/wiki/Fire_elemental "Fire elemental").

## History

The elven short sword first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"). From this version to [NetHack 3.2.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.2.3 "NetHack 3.2.3"), the [Elf](/wiki/Elf_\(role\) "Elf (role)") role starts with an elven short sword in place of their normal short sword if the TOLKIEN [compile-time option](/wiki/Compile-time_option "Compile-time option") is enabled.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [upgrading](/wiki/Upgrading "Upgrading") an elven short sword will produce a [dwarvish short sword](/wiki/Dwarvish_short_sword "Dwarvish short sword"), and upgrading a dwarvish short sword has a 1⁄2 chance of producing an elven short sword.

[Quick Blade](/wiki/Quick_Blade "Quick Blade") is a lawful [artifact weapon](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") whose base item is an elven short sword - it has +9 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") and deals +2 damage versus all monsters.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), an elven short sword deals 1d7 to all monsters, with a +2 to-hit bonus, and its weight is reduced to 10 [aum](/wiki/Aum "Aum").

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), elven [Rogues](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue") begin the game with an elven short sword as their primary weapon, making use of the existing code for racial substitutions. Elven soldiers and watchmen have an effective 1⁄3 chance to generate with elven short swords.

An elven short sword can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining an [elven dagger](/wiki/Elven_dagger "Elven dagger") and 2 [crossbow bolts](/wiki/Crossbow_bolt "Crossbow bolt"). Orcish short swords can be used to create a few items:

- An elven short sword can be combined with a [scimitar](/wiki/Scimitar "Scimitar") to create an [elven broadsword](/wiki/Elven_broadsword "Elven broadsword").
- Two elven short swords can be combined to create an [elven long sword](/wiki/Elven_long_sword "Elven long sword").

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), in addition to details and forging recipes from EvilHack, upgrading an elven short sword will produce a dwarvish short sword as in SLASH'EM, and upgrading a short sword will produce an elven short sword.

Hack'EM also retains Quick Blade from SLASH'EM.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 822](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L822)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 206](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L206): *Race-based substitutions for initial inventory*
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 233](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L233): *1⁄3 chance of bow weapon set*
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/mplayer.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 155](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mplayer.c#L155): *1⁄2 to get a random weapon - the designated range of objects covers weapons from the spear to the bullwhip inclusively in objects.c, and uses normal generation odds*
